intro: Camaridium atratum, commonly known as the blackleaf mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its dark green, velvety leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showing adaptability to harsh conditions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes other mallows and cotton plants. Camaridium atratum is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
